Key Arguments: The Bill threatens democratic rights by allowing the government to define truth and enforce it, exempting itself and mainstream media from regulations.
It contravenes international human rights standards, particularly freedom of speech as outlined in the UN Declaration of Human Rights and the ICCPR.
The Bill could suppress religious and political speech that contradicts prevailing ideologies.
It includes vague definitions of harm, misinformation, and disinformation, which could be weaponized to suppress legitimate speech.
The Bill grants excessive powers to ACMA, risking breaches of privacy and enabling government overreach.
There is a lack of accountability and transparency in how the Bill would be enforced, potentially leading to authoritarian censorship.
The Bill could perpetuate state-sponsored misinformation and disinformation, particularly in the context of COVID-19.
Notable Quotes: The Albanese Government's proposed Combating Misinformation and Disinformation Bill 2023 threatens the very heart of our democratic rights.
The Bill is inconsistent with fundamental freedoms of speech and communication under international human rights instruments.
The Bill puts too much power in the hands of unelected bureaucrats to silence speech in the public forum without transparency or accountability.
This shameful piece of intended legislation must be consigned to the rubbish bin of history.
